page.title: 07FARMING IN SABDEN CONTINUED
page.content:
In the area of our D-block there are 18 farms altogether.A typical farm is {Whitakers Barn Farm.Mrs.Dewhurst}came into school and supplied us with the following information.The farm consists{125}acres of land.They have {60}cows which are reared for beef.They have no dairy cattle.They also keep some sheep.They put fertilizer on there land between May and June and they cut for silage and hay.They have to buy straw for bedding and feed.They have one person to help on the milk round.They have owned the farm for{13 years.They do not milk their cows but buy it from a nearby farm.They have {two}tractors and own{120}pigs and{200 lambs.They hay make in June or July and store it in barns for the winter.
{MARK RILEY {
